entities.description: "PyTorch is an open-source machine learning library based on Torch, used for applications such as computer vision and natural language processing."
"Hugging Face is a company known for its contributions to the field of natural language processing, including the implementation of PyTorch."
"Spacy NER tagger is a named entity recognition tool used for extracting entities from text, part of the spaCy library."
"HOTPOTQA is an event or task that involves answering questions based on multiple supporting facts, indicating a complex question-answering challenge."
"Adam is associated with a learning rate in the context of the implementation details, likely referring to a person involved in the development process."
"Kingma is one of the authors of the Adam optimization algorithm, contributing to the field of machine learning."
"Ba is one of the authors of the Adam optimization algorithm, contributing to the field of machine learning."
"Comparison Questions is a concept referring to a type of question that involves comparing two entities, covered in the text."
"Question Operations are operations that cover comparison questions, identified as ten in number within the text."
"Algorithm 1 is the name of the algorithm used for identifying question operations in the context of comparison questions."
"Multi-hop is a concept related to question classification, referring to questions that require information from multiple paragraphs."
"Context-dependent Multi-hop is a concept related to question classification, referring to questions that depend on context and require information from multiple paragraphs."
"Single-hop is a concept related to question classification, referring to questions that can be answered using information from one paragraph."
"Henry Roth is mentioned as an example in the text, used to illustrate the answering of a comparison question."
"Robert Erskine Childers is mentioned as an example in the text, used to illustrate the answering of a comparison question."
"England is a geographical location mentioned in the text as an example of a fact that could be used to answer a comparison question."

"Comparison Questions are covered by the identified Question Operations."

"Multi-hop is a classification for certain types of Comparison Questions."

"Single-hop is a classification for certain types of Comparison Questions."
"Henry Roth and Robert Erskine Childers are both entities used as examples in the context of Comparison Questions."

entities.description: "HOTPOTQA is a dataset used for evaluating question answering systems, particularly focusing on single-hop and multi-hop reasoning."
"Yang et al. are researchers who have contributed to the understanding of HOTPOTQA by linking two paragraphs with an entity for bridge questions."
"NLP graduate students participated in a human study to evaluate single-hop human performance on HOTPOTQA bridge questions."
"Ralph Hefferline is an example of a person used in a multi-hop question where the location of his position as a psychology professor is sought."
"Sugawara et al. are researchers whose work on reducing questions to the first five tokens starting from the wh-word is referenced in the analysis of HOTPOTQA."
"Kaiser Ventures is an example used to illustrate questions that are compositional but solvable using only part of the question."
"American industrialist refers to a category of people, used in the context of the founder of Kaiser Ventures and father of modern American shipbuilding."
"Father of modern American shipbuilding refers to a specific individual, used in the context of the founder of Kaiser Ventures."
"Wikipedia is used as a source for selecting distractor paragraphs based on TF-IDF similarity with the question in the adversarial distractor selection process."
"Table 1 is referenced to show the F1 scores of single-paragraph BERT in the open-domain setting, indicating the challenge for the single-hop model."
"Table 2 categorizes bridge questions, showing the distribution of question types in HOTPOTQA and their solvability."
"Table 3 shows the automatic categorization of comparison questions and the performance of single-paragraph BERT on these questions."
"Table 4 describes the training and testing of the model on HOTPOTQA with different types of distractors."
"Multi-hop refers to the type of questions in HOTPOTQA that require reasoning across multiple pieces of information to find the answer."
"Weak Distractors is a category of questions in HOTPOTQA where single-hop answers are possible due to entity type matching."
"Redundant Evidence refers to questions in HOTPOTQA that have enough information in part of the question to be solvable with single-hop reasoning."
"Non-compositional Single-hop is a category of questions in HOTPOTQA that are non-compositional yet can be answered with single-hop reasoning."
"Comparison Questions are a type of question in HOTPOTQA that require quantitative or logical comparisons between two quantities or events."
"Adversarial Distractors are distractor paragraphs selected to trick the single-paragraph model by being similar to the question, based on TF-IDF similarity."
"Entity Type is used in the context of filtering distractors in the adversarial selection process, aiming to improve the difficulty of the questions."
"F1 Score is a measure of accuracy used to evaluate the performance of models on HOTPOTQA questions, particularly single-paragraph BERT."

relationships.description: "Yang et al. have conducted research on HOTPOTQA, specifically on bridge questions."
"NLP graduate students were used as participants in a human study to evaluate HOTPOTQA bridge questions."
"Ralph Hefferline is an example used in a multi-hop question within the HOTPOTQA dataset."
"Sugawara et al.'s work on question reduction is referenced in the analysis of HOTPOTQA questions."
"The founder of Kaiser Ventures is referred to as an American industrialist in the context of HOTPOTQA questions."
"The founder of Kaiser Ventures is also known as the father of modern American shipbuilding."
"Wikipedia is used as a resource for selecting distractor paragraphs in the adversarial distractor selection process for HOTPOTQA."
"Table 1 displays the F1 scores, which are used to evaluate the performance of the single-hop model in the open-domain setting."
"Table 2 includes the category Multi-hop, which represents 27% of the questions in HOTPOTQA."
"Table 2 includes the category Weak Distractors, which represents 35% of the questions in HOTPOTQA."
"Table 2 includes the category Redundant Evidence, which represents 26% of the questions in HOTPOTQA."
"Table 2 includes the category Non-compositional Single-hop, which represents 8% of the questions in HOTPOTQA."
"Table 3 is related to Comparison Questions, showing how single-paragraph BERT performs on these types of questions."

entities.description: "Sewon Min is an author affiliated with the University of Washington and involved in multi-hop reading comprehension research."
"Eric Wallace is an author affiliated with the Allen Institute for Artificial Intelligence and involved in multi-hop reading comprehension research."

"The University of Washington is an institution where some of the authors are affiliated and conduct research on multi-hop reading comprehension."

"The University of California, Irvine is an institution where one of the authors is affiliated and involved in multi-hop reading comprehension research."
"HOTPOTQA is a dataset of mostly compositional questions used in the analysis of multi-hop reading comprehension."
"The Democratic Republic of the Congo is a geographical location where the Lomako Forest Reserve is found, which is relevant to the multi-hop reading comprehension research."

The Lomako Forest Reserve, also known as R´eserve Naturelle Lomako Yokokala, is a geographical location established to protect the habitat of the Bonobo apes in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It is mentioned in the context of multi-hop reading comprehension research.

Bonobo, also known as 'Pan paniscus', is an endangered great ape whose habitat is protected by the Lomako Forest Reserve in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It is formerly known as Pygmy Chimpanzee, Dwarf Chimpanzee, and Gracile Chimpanzee, and is part of the multi-hop reading comprehension research context.
"WIKIHOP is a dataset used in the construction of multi-hop QA datasets, mentioned in the context of multi-hop reading comprehension research."
"BERT is a model used as the basis for a single-hop QA model in the research on multi-hop reading comprehension."
"ComplexWebQuestions is an open-domain dataset that uses large distractor sets, as mentioned in the multi-hop reading comprehension research."
"Pygmy Chimpanzee is a former name for the bonobo, an endangered great ape, relevant to the multi-hop reading comprehension research."
"Dwarf Chimpanzee is a former name for the bonobo, an endangered great ape, mentioned in the context of multi-hop reading comprehension research."
"Gracile Chimpanzee is a former name for the bonobo, an endangered great ape, relevant to the multi-hop reading comprehension research."

entities.description: "The event refers to the research conducted by Kocˇisky\` and colleagues in 2018, which introduced multi-hop QA."
"The event refers to the research conducted by Talmor and Berant in 2018, which contributed to the understanding of multi-hop QA."
"The event refers to the research conducted by Yang and colleagues in 2018, which is related to multi-hop QA and HOTPOTQA."
"WIKIHOP is a dataset constructed using knowledge bases, mentioned in the context of multi-hop QA."
"COMPLEXWEBQUESTIONS is a dataset consisting of open-domain compositional questions, constructed from WEBQUESTIONS."
"HOTPOTQA is a dataset that consists of multi-hop questions requiring reasoning over two paragraphs from Wikipedia."
"The event refers to the research conducted by Welbl and colleagues in 2017, which is associated with the WIKIHOP dataset."
"The event refers to the research conducted by Berant and colleagues in 2013, which is related to the WEBQUESTIONS dataset."
"The event refers to the research conducted by Chen and Durrett in 2019, presenting similar findings on HOTPOTQA."
"The event refers to the research conducted by Clark and Gardner in 2018, which is used as a comparison for the single-paragraph BERT model."
"The event refers to the research conducted by Devlin and colleagues in 2018, which is related to the BERT model."
"The event refers to the research conducted by Chen and colleagues in 2017, which is related to paragraph retrieval using bigram TF-IDF similarity."
"BERT is a model used in the single-paragraph BERT approach for answering questions."
"F1 scores are used to measure the performance of the single-paragraph BERT model on HOTPOTQA."
"Distractor Setting is one of the two settings in HOTPOTQA where questions are paired with gold paragraphs and spurious paragraphs."
"Open-domain Setting is the setting in HOTPOTQA where all of Wikipedia is considered and paragraphs are retrieved using bigram TF-IDF similarity."

TF-IDF similarity is a method used to select spurious paragraphs in the Distractor Setting and to retrieve paragraphs in the Open-domain Setting of HOTPOTQA, also referred to as BIGRAM TF-IDF SIMILARITY in the context of paragraph retrieval.
"Gold paragraphs are the two paragraphs the question was written for, used in the Distractor Setting of HOTPOTQA."
"Spurious paragraphs are the paragraphs selected using TF-IDF similarity with the question, used in the Distractor Setting of HOTPOTQA."
"yempty is a scalar value used in the single-paragraph BERT model to select the answer from the paragraph with the lowest score."
"yspan is one of the scalars generated by the classifier in the single-paragraph BERT model, indicating the answer is a span."
"yyes is one of the scalars generated by the classifier in the single-paragraph BERT model, indicating the answer is 'yes'."
"yno is one of the scalars generated by the classifier in the single-paragraph BERT model, indicating the answer is 'no'."
"Span refers to an extractive paragraph span, which is obtained separately in the single-paragraph BERT model."
"Wikipedia is the source of all paragraphs considered in the Open-domain Setting of HOTPOTQA."

relationships.description: "Yang et al., 2018 conducted research related to multi-hop QA and HOTPOTQA."
